topic.title: (Optional) Create Virtual Machine Wizard: Unattended Guest OS Install

body.p: Unattended guest OS installation enables you to install the OS on a virtual machine automatically.

note.p: This page is optional. It is not displayed if you have selected the Skip Unattended Installation option on the initial wizard page.

body.p: Use this page to set up the required parameters for unattended guest OS installation and to configure automatic installation of the Oracle VM VirtualBox Guest Additions. See also for some typical scenarios when using automated installation.

fig.title: Creating a Virtual Machine: Unattended Guest OS Installation

body.p: The following fields are available on this wizard page:

li.p: Username and Password. Enter the credentials for a default user on the guest OS.

Guest Additions. Enables automatic installation of the Guest Additions, following installation of the guest OS. Use the drop-down list to select the location of the ISO image file for the Guest Additions.
Additional Options. The following options enable you to perform extra configuration of the guest OS:
Product Key. For Windows guests only. Enter the product key required for Windows installation.
Hostname. Host name for the guest. By default, this is the same as the VM name.
Domain Name. Domain name for the guest.
Install in Background. Enable headless mode for the VM, where a graphical user interface is not shown.

body.p: Click Next to go to the next wizard page.
